            "language": [["Plain Text"]],
            "title": [
              [
                "<!doctype html>\n<html>\n<head>\n<style>\n    body{ background-color:white; }\n    #canvas{border:1px solid red; }\n</style>\n<script>\nwindow.onload=(function(){\n\n    // canvas related variables\n    var canvas=document.getElementById(\"canvas\");\n    var ctx=canvas.getContext(\"2d\");\n    var cw=canvas.width;\n    var ch=canvas.height;\n    // canvas styling for the clock\n    ctx.strokeStyle='lightgray';\n    ctx.fillStyle='skyblue';\n    ctx.lineWidth=5;\n    \n    // cache often used values\n    var PI=Math.PI;\n    var fullCircle=PI*2;\n    var sa=-PI/2;   // == the 12 o'clock angle in context.arc\n    \n    // start the animation\n    requestAnimationFrame(animate);\n\n    function animate(currentTime){\n\n        // get the current seconds value from the system clock\n        var date=new Date();\n        var seconds=date.getSeconds();\n        \n        // clear the canvas\n        ctx.clearRect(0,0,cw,ch);\n        \n        // draw a full circle (== the clock face);\n        ctx.beginPath();\n        ctx.moveTo(100,100);\n        ctx.arc(100,100,75,0,fullCircle);\n        ctx.stroke();\n        // draw a wedge representing the current seconds value\n        ctx.beginPath();\n        ctx.moveTo(100,100);\n        ctx.arc(100,100,75,sa,sa+fullCircle*seconds/60);\n        ctx.fill();\n\n        // request another loop of animation\n        requestAnimationFrame(animate);\n    }\n\n}); // end $(function(){});\n</script>\n</head>\n<body>\n    <canvas id=\"canvas\" width=512 height=512></canvas>\n</body>\n</html>"
              ]
            ]
